section.para: blaze-init creates a &PRODUCT; repository, or recovers a previously corrupted one.

section.title: Description
section.para: blaze-init either creates a fresh new &PRODUCT; repository, or recovers an existing one in case it is corrupted. Optionally, it can also revert a configuration and default templates to their original state, leaving all user data (that is, both blog posts and pages) intact.

listitem.para: Enables you to specify a directory in which the &PRODUCT; repository is to be blaced. The default option is a current working directory.
Tells blaze-init to revert existing configuration, theme, and language files to their initial state. By default, these files are kept intact.
Enables displaying of all messages, including a list of created files.
Create a new blog in a current directory:
listitem.screen: ~]$ blaze-init Created a BlazeBlogger repository in .blaze.
~]$ blaze-init -b ~/public_html Created a BlazeBlogger repository in /home/jhradilek/public_html/.blaze.

listitem.para: Revert a configuration file and default templates to their initial state:
listitem.screen: ~]$ blaze-init -f Recovered a BlazeBlogger repository in .blaze.
listitem.para: Or if you want to see what files have been reverted:
listitem.screen: ~]$ blaze-init -fV Created .blaze/config Created .blaze/theme/default.html Created .blaze/style/default.css Created .blaze/lang/en_US Recovered a BlazeBlogger repository in .blaze.

listitem.para: blaze-config displays or sets &PRODUCT; configuration options.
blaze-add adds a blog post or a page to the &PRODUCT; repository.
